item.title: Search and replace text in many files
item.description: This is a handy one liner that searches and replaces text in multiple files. (You can use find for example to run it in multiple folders) perl -pi -e 's/old_text/new_text/g' *.conf This line replaces old_text with new_text in all the .conf files in the current folder. Of course you can use regular expressions.

item.title: Installed Google Custom Search, no results are showing.
item.description: I did a website for a friend, a kind of a knowledge base and installed google custom search on it. To my surprise google stubornly kept showing no search results. I redid the custom search settings, paying close attention to the domains on which I wanted the search limited on, but still no results. I took a quick walk on the Google Help boulevard but I didn’t find anything. A google search later and I found numerous causes: wrong definitions for the domains on which the search is limited, wrong integration of the code, wrong definition of the result page the form should point to.
